trans-unit.source: Move Resources to New Resource Group
trans-unit.target: Move Resources to New Resource Group

trans-unit.source: Use Azure PowerShell or REST API to move resources to a new resource group for Azure Resource Manager.
trans-unit.target: Use Azure PowerShell or REST API to move resources to a new resource group for Azure Resource Manager.

trans-unit.source: Move resources to new resource group or subscription
trans-unit.target: Move resources to new resource group or subscription

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to move resources from one resource group to another resource group.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to move resources from one resource group to another resource group.

trans-unit.source: You can also move resources to a new subscription.
trans-unit.target: You can also move resources to a new subscription.

trans-unit.source: You may need to move resources when you decide that:
trans-unit.target: You may need to move resources when you decide that:

trans-unit.source: For billing purposes, a resource needs to live in a different subscription.
trans-unit.target: For billing purposes, a resource needs to live in a different subscription.

trans-unit.source: A resource no longer shares the same lifecycle as the resources it was previously grouped with.
trans-unit.target: A resource no longer shares the same lifecycle as the resources it was previously grouped with.

trans-unit.source: You want to move it to a new resource group so you can manage that resource separately from the other resources.
trans-unit.target: You want to move it to a new resource group so you can manage that resource separately from the other resources.

trans-unit.source: A resource now shares the same lifecycle as other resources in a different resource group.
trans-unit.target: A resource now shares the same lifecycle as other resources in a different resource group.

trans-unit.source: You want to move it to the resource group with the other resources so you can manage them together.
trans-unit.target: You want to move it to the resource group with the other resources so you can manage them together.

trans-unit.source: There are some important considerations when moving a resource:
trans-unit.target: There are some important considerations when moving a resource:

trans-unit.source: You cannot change the location of the resource.
trans-unit.target: You cannot change the location of the resource.

trans-unit.source: Moving a resource only moves it to a new resource group.
trans-unit.target: Moving a resource only moves it to a new resource group.

trans-unit.source: The new resource group may have a different location, but that does
trans-unit.target: The new resource group may have a different location, but that does

trans-unit.source: not change the location of the resource.
trans-unit.target: not change the location of the resource.

trans-unit.source: The destination resource group should contain only resources that share the same application lifecycle as the resources you are moving.
trans-unit.target: The destination resource group should contain only resources that share the same application lifecycle as the resources you are moving.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Azure PowerShell, make sure you are using the latest version.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Azure PowerShell, make sure you are using the latest version.

trans-unit.source: The Move-AzureResource command is updated frequently.
trans-unit.target: The Move-AzureResource command is updated frequently.

trans-unit.source: To update your version, run the Microsoft Web Platform Installer and check if a
trans-unit.target: To update your version, run the Microsoft Web Platform Installer and check if a

trans-unit.source: new version is available.
trans-unit.target: new version is available.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The move operation can take a while to complete and during that time your PowerShell prompt will wait until the operation has completed.
trans-unit.target: The move operation can take a while to complete and during that time your PowerShell prompt will wait until the operation has completed.

trans-unit.source: Supported services
trans-unit.target: Supported services

trans-unit.source: Not all services currently support the ability to move resources.
trans-unit.target: Not all services currently support the ability to move resources.

trans-unit.source: For now, the services that support moving to both a new resource group and subscription are:
trans-unit.target: For now, the services that support moving to both a new resource group and subscription are:

trans-unit.source: API Management
trans-unit.target: API Management

trans-unit.source: Azure Search
trans-unit.target: Azure Search

trans-unit.source: Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Data Factory

trans-unit.source: Key Vault
trans-unit.target: Key Vault

trans-unit.source: Mobile Engagement
trans-unit.target: Mobile Engagement

trans-unit.source: Operational Insights
trans-unit.target: Operational Insights

trans-unit.source: Redis Cache
trans-unit.target: Redis Cache

trans-unit.source: Azure Web Apps (some <link><linkText>limitations</linkText><title></title></link> apply)
trans-unit.target: Azure Web Apps (some <link><linkText>limitations</linkText><title></title></link> apply)

trans-unit.source: The services that support moving to a new resource group but not a new subscription are:
trans-unit.target: The services that support moving to a new resource group but not a new subscription are:

trans-unit.source: Compute (classic)
trans-unit.target: Compute (classic)

trans-unit.source: Storage (classic)
trans-unit.target: Storage (classic)

trans-unit.source: The services that currently do not support moving a resource are:
trans-unit.target: The services that currently do not support moving a resource are:

trans-unit.source: Virtual Networks
trans-unit.target: Virtual Networks

trans-unit.source: When working with web apps, you cannot move only an App Service plan.
trans-unit.target: When working with web apps, you cannot move only an App Service plan.

trans-unit.source: To move web apps, your options are:
trans-unit.target: To move web apps, your options are:

trans-unit.source: Move all of the resources from one resource group to a different resource group, if the destination resource group does not already have Microsoft.Web resources.
trans-unit.target: Move all of the resources from one resource group to a different resource group, if the destination resource group does not already have Microsoft.Web resources.

trans-unit.source: Move the web apps to a different resource group, but keep the App Service plan in the original resource group.
trans-unit.target: Move the web apps to a different resource group, but keep the App Service plan in the original resource group.

trans-unit.source: Using PowerShell to move resources
trans-unit.target: Using PowerShell to move resources

trans-unit.source: To move existing resources to another resource group or subscription, use the Move-AzureResource command.
trans-unit.target: To move existing resources to another resource group or subscription, use the Move-AzureResource command.

trans-unit.source: The first example shows how to move one resource to a new resource group.
trans-unit.target: The first example shows how to move one resource to a new resource group.

trans-unit.source: The second example shows how to move multiple resources to a new resource group.
trans-unit.target: The second example shows how to move multiple resources to a new resource group.

trans-unit.source: To move to a new subscription, include a value for the DestinationSubscriptionId parameter.
trans-unit.target: To move to a new subscription, include a value for the DestinationSubscriptionId parameter.

trans-unit.source: Using REST API to move resources
trans-unit.target: Using REST API to move resources

trans-unit.source: To move existing resources to another resource group or subscription, run:
trans-unit.target: To move existing resources to another resource group or subscription, run:

trans-unit.source: Replace {source-subscription-id} and {source-resource-group-name} with the subscription and resource group that currently contain the resources you wish to move.
trans-unit.target: Replace {source-subscription-id} and {source-resource-group-name} with the subscription and resource group that currently contain the resources you wish to move.

trans-unit.source: Use 2015-01-01 for {api-version}.
trans-unit.target: Use 2015-01-01 for {api-version}.

trans-unit.source: In the request, include a JSON object that defines the target resource group and the resources you wish to move.
trans-unit.target: In the request, include a JSON object that defines the target resource group and the resources you wish to move.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Using the Azure Portal to manage resources</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Using tags to organize your resources</linkText><title></title></link>
